profile_positions.description: Freelance communication advisor. Until recently responsible for education and training projects in the field of government communication in new and future EU- member states. Graduated in Law at Leiden University. Was press and Information Officer of a municipality and of a ministry. Was secretary of the Government Information Council. Was advisor to the General Director of the Government Information Service (Prime Minister’s Office) in The Hague. Was closely involved in the development of the joint infrastructure of the communication departments of the Dutch ministries. Coordinated the work of inter-ministerial committees on government communication. Currently assists various voluntary organisations with their communication activities.

profile_positions.description: Freelance advisor on government communication. Organizes education and training projects in the field of government communication in new and (potential) candidate-member states of the European Union. Cooperates with central governments, institutes for higher education, non-governmental organizations and independent consultants. Was responsible for cooperation projects in Poland, Hungary and Slovenia. Contributed to training projects and advisory activities in Latvia, Romania, Bulgaria and various other countries. Co-organized an accredited government communication curriculum organized by the University of Pécs in Hungary. Graduated in Law at the Leiden University. Former reporter for a regional newspaper. Former deputy head of the Information Department of the Municipality of Leiden. Former press and information officer at the Ministry of Housing, Spatial Planning and the Environment. Former secretary of the Government Information Council (inter-ministerial committee on government information policy, accountable to the Prime Minister). Former advisor to the General Director of the Government Information Service (Prime Minister’s Office). Closely involved in developing the joint infrastructure of the communication departments of the Dutch ministries and in establishing the P.O. Box 51 Call Centre. Coordinated the work of three inter-ministerial committees on government communication. Contributed to the work of the state committee on the reform of government communication. Contributed to cabinet policy documents on crisis communication and other  communication issues. Contributed to various publications, including Government Communication in The Netherlands (Katus and Volmer, eds., 2000) and Government Communication, the Dutch Experience (Den Besten and Volmer, eds., 2005). Emeritus member of the Venice Club, the informal contact group of central government communication services in Europe. Rewarded with the Golden Cross of Merit of the Republic of Hungary.
